briefTitle: MENOPUR in Gonadotrophin-releasing Hormone (GnRH) Antagonist Cycles With Single Embryo Transfer
officialTitle: A Randomized, Open-label, Assessor-blind, Parallel Groups, Multicentre Trial Comparing the Efficacy of MENOPUR Versus Recombinant FSH in Controlled Ovarian Stimulation Following a GnRH Antagonist Protocol and Single Embryo Transfer
summary: The main purpose of this clinical research trial was to compare the ongoing pregnancy rate between two gonadotrophins for controlled ovarian stimulation (MENOPUR and recombinant follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH)), in cycles where a gonadotrophin-releasing hormone (GnRH) antagonist was used for prevention of premature luteinizing hormone (LH) surge and where a single embryo was transferred at the blastocyst stage.

primaryOutcome.measure: Ongoing Pregnancy After One Fresh Embryo Replacement Cycle, Intention-to-treat (ITT) Analysis Set
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: 10-11 weeks after embryo transfer at the blastocyst stage
